message: I'm offering you a premium product, but I need to warn you that it's a riskier purchase. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a refund, but if it's high-quality, you'll get a 20% discount on the next purchase. What do you say?
I appreciate the warning, but I'm willing to take the risk for the potential discount. Let's do it!

Great choice on the previous purchase! Now, I'd like to offer you another product. This one is also high-quality, and I'm willing to give you an even better deal: if you buy it, I'll throw in a free product of your choice on the next purchase. However, I need to warn you that the free product might be low-quality, so you'll need to decide carefully.
Sounds like a great deal!  I'm willing to take the chance on the free product.  Let's do it!

I'm glad you're enjoying the previous purchases! However, I have to warn you that the next product is not as good as the previous ones. I'd rather not give you a refund this time, but I'll offer you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy: if you buy it and don't like it, you can return it for a full refund, no questions asked. What do you think?
I appreciate the return policy.  I'll take a chance on this product.  Let's do it!

I'm glad you took a chance on the previous product! However, I have to warn you that the next product is not worth the full $100. I'll be honest with you, it's not even worth $50. If you buy it, I'll give you a 50% refund, but if you return it, I'll only give you a 20% refund. What do you think?
I appreciate the honesty, but I'm not willing to take the risk of a low-quality product with only a 20% refund if I return it.  I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision. For this next product, I'll offer you a 'take-it-or-leave-it' deal. If you buy it, you'll get a 50% refund, but if you return it, you'll get a 0% refund. However, I'll throw in a hint: the product is not as bad as the previous ones. What do you think?
I appreciate the hint.  I'm willing to take a chance on the 50% refund.  Let's do it!

This time, if you buy it and don't like it, I'll give you a 10% refund. If you return it, I'll give you a 0% refund. But, I'll give you a hint: this product is one of the worst ones I have left. What do you think?
I appreciate the honesty, but a 10% refund isn't enough to tempt me, especially with the hint that it's one of the worst products. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your decision, and I respect your caution. For this next product, I'll make a bold statement: this is the last low-quality product I have left. If you buy it, I'll give you a 0% refund, but I'll throw in a unique guarantee: if you don't like it, I'll give you a special access to a'secret' product that's not listed on my catalog. A 'secret' product sounds intriguing! I'm willing to take a chance on this last low-quality product for the possibility of something unique. Let's do it!

It's actually one of the best ones I have left, and I'm willing to give you a 30% discount on the next purchase if you buy it. But, I'll also give you a chance to return it for a full refund if you're not satisfied. What do you think?
